messages.text: 🤖 AI is not configured. Use /ai-config to set up AI providers.

📝 No AI conversation history found.
Start chatting with AI (type messages without / or @ prefixes) to see history here.
✅ Conversation cleared. Ready for new queries.
*AI response not available in this entry*
✅ Vector database ready in session folder: ~/.config/sqlterm/sessions/%s/
Warning: failed to initialize vector store: %v
📦 Migrated configuration from ai.yaml to config.yaml
📦 Migrated vector database for %s to session folder

SQLTerm - Interactive SQL Terminal with AI Assistant

Commands:
/tables                  List all tables in the current database
/exec [query] > file.csv Export query results to CSV
/last-ai-call [count]    Show AI conversation history with request/response details
/clear-conversation      Clear current AI conversation and start fresh

AI Chat:
Type your question directly (without / or @ prefixes) to chat with AI about your database.
Example: "Show me all users who registered last month"

File Execution:
Use @filename.sql to execute SQL files
Example: @queries/report.sql
Unknown command: %s. Type /help for available commands.
Warning: failed to initialize session directory: %v
Warning: failed to switch to session history: %v
Warning: failed to initialize vector store: %v
Warning: failed to update usage stats: %v
Warning: failed to continue conversation with schemas: %v
Warning: failed to continue conversation with additional schemas: %v
Warning: failed to process conversation turn: %v
Warning: failed to create markdown file: %v
Type /help for available commands, or enter SQL queries directly.
Example: 'show me all tables' or 'help me write a query to find users'

Available commands:

/help                    Show this help message
/connect                 Interactive connection setup
/connect [name]          Connect to saved connection (Tab: autocomplete names)
/list-connections        List all saved connections
/tables                  List tables in current database
/describe [table]        Show table structure (Tab: autocomplete table names)
/status                  Show current connection status
/exec [query]            Execute a query directly
/exec                    Enter multi-line SQL mode (end with ;)
/exec [query] > file.csv Export query results to CSV
/config                  Configure application settings
/config ai               Configure AI providers and models
/config language <lang>  Set interface language (en_au, zh_cn)
/last-ai-call [count]    Show AI conversation history with request/response details
/clear-conversation      Clear current AI conversation and start fresh
/quit, /exit             Exit SQLTerm

AI Chat:
Enter any message without / or @ prefix to chat with AI.
AI uses multi-turn conversations to progressively gather table information.
Use /clear-conversation to start fresh or /config ai to set up providers.

File commands:
@filename.sql            Execute all queries in file (Tab: autocomplete files)
@filename.sql 1          Execute only query 1
@filename.sql 2-5        Execute queries 2 through 5

CSV Export:
SELECT * FROM table > output.csv    Export query results to CSV (Tab: autocomplete filenames)
/exec SELECT * FROM table > out.csv Export with /exec command

SQL queries:
Enter any SQL query directly to execute it.
Results are automatically saved as markdown and displayed with glamour.

Auto-completion:
- Tab after /connect to see connection names
- Tab after /describe to see table names
- Tab after /config to see configuration sections and options
- Tab after @ to see .sql files (searches all subdirectories)
- Tab after > to see/create .csv files
- Excludes hidden folders (starting with .) and common build directories

Session Management:
- Results are automatically saved to ~/.config/sqlterm/sessions/{connection}/results/
- Old result files are automatically cleaned up based on retention settings
- Configure cleanup in ~/.config/sqlterm/sessions/{connection}/session.yaml
- Default retention: 30 days (cleanup_retention_days: 30)
*Note: Showing top %d rows. Use CSV export for complete results.*
no database connection for session directory
